main event: A large, oblong/elliptical object, approximately 25 feet in size, was observed by several witnesses. The object was rotating and moving too fast and too big to be a conventional aircraft.
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple witnesses, including police patrolmen on a boat in Jamaica Bay, New York.
The object was seen traveling in a westerly direction across Jamaica Bay towards the Naval Air Station in New York City.
The object was observed for a period of approximately 10 minutes between 2220Z and 2230Z on November 3, 1961.
The object was described as being too big and too fast to be a star or a conventional aircraft.
The report concludes that the object was possibly a balloon, but the evaluation was inconclusive.
sighted object: a large, oblong/elliptical object, approximately 25 feet in size
witnesses: several witnesses, including police patrolmen on a boat
